ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS:

Proof of Canadian Citizenship;
The Co-op student must be able to obtain reliability status security clearance and maintain it for the duration of the co-op term;
Proof of having lived in Canada for at least the past five years.


8 MONTH WORK TERM

Work Duration: 8 months (An 8 month employment period is registered as 2 separate, consecutive work terms). Please state CLEARLY in your cover letter whether you are available for 8 months.

Note for Engineering Undergraduate Students: Before applying to this posting, it is your responsibility to have completed the appropriate pre-requisite courses for this length of work term, and to understand how this length of work term affects your academics. Engineering undergrads -- If this means you will be registered in a 5th or higher work term, the full co-op tuition fee (equal to two installments) will be charged for each extra work term above the mandatory four.

About JEA

James Evans and Associates, Ltd. is a Victoria-based company that has been doing business in Canada and the United States for over 45 years. We have an excellent, well-established reputation in the Canadian and US pension industry. JEA offers SaaS and on-premises pension system administration solutions, along with pension system consulting services to a variety of clients with a diversity of needs. With over 45 years of history, JEA has proven we are both adaptable and reliable - and that, above all, we strive to form true partnerships with our clients, ensuring we develop, implement and support the "best in class" pension solutions for their organizations and members.

The successful applicant will join an Agile Scrum team that builds, maintains, and delivers JEA's products to our SaaS and on-premises clients utilizing the following tools and skills:

JIRA
Bitbucket/Git
SQL
Oracle PL/SQL
Oracle JDeveloper
Oracle BI Publisher
JasperReports
Katalon Studio
REST APIs
Java
Javascript
XML

Location

JEA has offices in Victoria, BC, and Winnipeg, MB, as well as remote workers across Canada. We encourage applicants from all of Canada to apply.

JEA welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Perks and benefits

Our Victoria office is near the Selkirk Trestle, close to the city center with great dining-out options and easy access to the Galloping Goose Trail
Our Winnipeg office is located downtown in the middle of the Sports, Hospitality and Entertainment District, one block from the Winnipeg Jets' arena
Flexible work location (hybrid home and office)
Commuter allowance
Casual dress
A company that's committed to a work-life balance
Friendly, easy-to-get-along-with team where open dialog and knowledge-sharing is encouraged and promoted
Free snacks and drinks
We tend to hire former coops students on full time after graduation

Skills and Experience

Applicants should have strong analytical and technical skills and a love of learning.
Software development experience, including working on a web development team, interpreting specifications, and testing application components either in school or work experience.
Working towards a degree or diploma in Computer Science, Software or Computer Engineering, or a related field.
Must be eligible to work in Canada.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance as a condition of employment; this includes having lived in Canada for at least the past five years.
Attention to detail in oral and written communications and the ability to write for a technical audience. Robust analytical and problem-solving skills.
The ability to manage multiple priorities and consistently produce results within timelines.
The ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships with team members and others.
Knowledge of software development life cycle and object-oriented development methodologies, including design principles, techniques and tools.
Experience with current industry-standard software development technologies and development tools.

Other Experiences

Experience working on an Agile team.
Experience with Katalon Studio.
Proficiency in Groovy scripting.
Familiarity with pension administration or financial system software.
An understanding of website UI and UX best practices.
An understanding of web usability and accessibility standards.
Preference given to applicants with experience in:
SQL
Oracle
Katalon Studio
Katalon Runtime Engine
Groovy
Java
Junit
REST APIs
React
